content: What iconic New York City building, completed in 1931, was the world's tallest building until 1970?

That would be the Empire State Building. It's an iconic Art Deco skyscraper located in Midtown Manhattan, New York City. It held the title of the world's tallest building for nearly 40 years until the completion of the North Tower of the World Trade Center in 1970. The Empire State Building has become a global cultural icon of New York City, and its distinctive Art Deco architecture and spire have made it one of the most recognizable buildings in the world.
